title: Facebook parent Meta just had its biggest single-day stock gain in nearly 9 years
text: Fresh off a quarter that wasn't as catastrophic as some analysts feared, Facebook parent company Meta Platforms Inc.'s stock ended Thursday with its largest percentage increase since July 25, 2013, when it rose 29.6%, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

title: Meta Platforms: OK Earnings, Deep Value

title: Meta Platforms Q1 Earnings: Growth Still Priced As Value
text: Meta Platforms surged up to 17% after it reported its Q1 profits on Wednesday. The company's core business remains intact, revenues rose 7% to $27.9 billion and daily active users rose 4% to 1.96 billion, topping expectations.

title: Why Meta Platforms Stock Charged Sharply on Thursday
text: The company added users to its family of social media platforms last quarter, helping calm investor fears.

title: Meta Platforms' (FB) Q1 Earnings Beat Mark, Revenues Up Y/Y
text: Meta Platforms' (FB) first-quarter 2022 performance suffers from unfavorable foreign exchange, lower ad spending in Europe, negative impact of the Russia-Ukraine conflict and slowdown in e-commerce.

title: Meta expanding massive $1 billion Illinois data center, set to power everything from Facebook to Instagram
text: Meta, the social media giant formerly known as Facebook, is expanding its massive $1 billion data center under construction in DeKalb to nearly 2.4 million square feet, putting the college town west of Chicago at the center of its metaverse.

title: 3 Tech Stocks To Watch Today After Earnings Reports

title: Meta Platforms: WhatsApp Pay Gains More Traction
text: WhatsApp Pay got off to a slow start in India, but there are exciting developments. The company continues to face stiff competition in one of the largest consumer markets in the world but upcoming regulatory changes might help WhatsApp Pay overcome some of these challenges.

title: Meta Platforms Soars, Return to Growth: ETFs to Tap
text: Meta Platforms returned to growth after the first-ever decline in the December quarter and beat earnings estimates.

title: Meta Beats Earnings, Reviving Investors' Faith
text: Meta Platforms ( FB , Financial), the company formerly known as Facebook, reported earnings for its first quarter of 2022 on Wednesday after the market closed.

title: Meta Platforms Stock Bounces Back After Earnings
text: Facebook-parent Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ:FB) threw its hat into the earnings ring after yesterday's close, reporting better-than-expected first-quarter earnings of $2.72 per share.

title: Is FB Stock a Buy on Q1 Earnings? 3 Analysts Weigh In on Meta Platforms.

title: Meta spreads cheer on Wall Street as Facebook adds more users
text: Shares of Meta Platforms Inc rose 17% in a relief rally on Thursday after having lost nearly half their value this year, as the social media giant surprised Wall Street with a better-than-expected rise in users joining the platform.

title: Meta shares surge 16% in pre-market trading after earnings beat
text: Meta reported earnings per share of $2.72, higher than the $2.56 expected by analysts.

title: Why Meta Platforms Shares Are Ripping Higher Today
text: Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ: FB) shares are trading higher Thursday after the company reported better-than-expected earnings results. Meta said first-quarter revenue increased 7% year-over-year to $27.91 billion, which came in below the $28.21 billion estimate.

title: Facebook parent Meta soars 17% after Q1 results show user growth recovery, and Mark Zuckerberg reins in metaverse spending
text: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said he's slowing the pace of the Facebook parent's investment in new projects, including the metaverse, after revenue missed estimates.

title: The Trouble For Big Tech Stocks In 2 Charts
text: This month (so far) has been the worst for the Nasdaq since the stock market was in the throes of the Great Financial Crisis back in 2008. The bearish tandem of falling free cash flow and waning liquidity suggests extreme valuations could revert in a major way.

title: 7 Long-Term Stocks to Buy for a Robust Retirement
text: The amount of years you spend in retirement may vary, yet it's not a bad idea to err on the side of caution. That is, you should build a portfolio that can grow and provide income for 15, 20, perhaps even 30 years.

title: EU court rules against Meta over German consumer body challenge
text: The European Union's top court ruled on Thursday that Germany's consumer protection association could bring a legal challenge against Facebook parent Meta over data privacy.

title: Market Snapshot: U.S. stock futures rise on relief over Facebook parent's subscriber numbers as GDP report awaits
text: U.S. stock futures pointed to a stronger start on Thursday, boosted by results from Facebook parent Meta Platforms that weren't as bad as anticipated.
